intro: Sabatia campanulata, commonly known as the bellflower saxifrage, is a flowering plant native to North America. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. It is part of the tribe Melampodieae within the family Caryophyllaceae. Sabatia campanulata is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
